snippet: The minor leaguer Peter O’Brien, a slugging catcher, played third base in the Arizona Instructional League and could eventually play there for New York if Alex Rodriguez is not welcomed back.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Baseball column holds that minor leaguer Peter O’Brien, slugging catcher, played third base in the Arizona Instructional League and could eventually play there for New York Yankees if Alex Rodriguez is not welcomed back.
lead_paragraph: The minor leaguer Peter O’Brien, a slugging catcher, played third base in the Arizona Instructional League and could eventually play there for New York if Alex Rodriguez is not welcomed back.

headline.main: Now No. 96 for Yankees, Possible Future Alternative to No. 13
headline.print_headline: Now No. 96 for Yankees, Possible Future Alternative to No. 13
